questions.text: Which PowerShell command is used to get help information about a specific command?
questions.explanation: The Get-Help command displays help information about PowerShell commands and concepts.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command is used to start a job?
questions.explanation: The Start-Job command starts a background job in PowerShell.

questions.text: The Out-File command is used to display output to the console in PowerShell.
questions.explanation: The Out-File command is used to send output to a file, not the console. The Write-Host command is used to display output to the console.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command is used to stop a running process?
questions.explanation: The Stop-Process command stops a running process in PowerShell.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command is used to define a variable?
questions.explanation: The Set-Item command can be used to define a variable, although it's more commonly used for setting registry keys or file system items.

questions.text: The New-SMBShare command is used to create a new user account in PowerShell.
questions.explanation: The New-SMBShare command is used to create a new SMB share, not a user account.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command is used to get a list of all services?
questions.explanation: The Get-Service command retrieves a list of all services on the system.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command is used to get the content of a file?
questions.explanation: The Get-Content command retrieves the content of a file.

questions.text: The 'Test-Path' command is used to test if a service is running in PowerShell.
questions.explanation: The 'Test-Path' command is used to test if a path exists, not if a service is running. Get-Service can be used to check service status.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command is used to create a new directory?
questions.explanation: The New-Item command with the -ItemType Directory parameter is used to create a new directory.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command is used to remove an item (file or directory)?
questions.explanation: The Remove-Item command is used to remove an item (file or directory).

questions.text: The 'Rename-Item' command is used to copy a file in PowerShell.
questions.explanation: The 'Rename-Item' command is used to rename a file or directory, not copy it. Copy-Item is used to copy files.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command is used to copy a file?
questions.explanation: The Copy-Item command is used to copy a file.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command is used to move a file?
questions.explanation: The Move-Item command is used to move a file.

questions.text: The 'Clear-Content' command is used to delete a file in PowerShell.
questions.explanation: The 'Clear-Content' command is used to clear the content of a file, not delete it. Remove-Item is used to delete a file.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command is used to get a list of all commands?
questions.explanation: The Get-Command command retrieves a list of all available commands.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command is used to set the execution policy?
questions.explanation: The Set-ExecutionPolicy command sets the execution policy, which controls which scripts can be run.

questions.text: The 'Get-Process' command is used to get a list of all services in PowerShell.
questions.explanation: The 'Get-Process' command is used to get a list of all processes, not services. Get-Service is used to get services.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command is used to test if a variable is null or empty?
questions.explanation: You can use -eq $null or [string]::IsNullOrEmpty() to check if a variable is null or empty.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command is used to create a new SMB share?
questions.explanation: The New-SMBShare command is used to create a new SMB share.

questions.text: How can you retrieve the contents of a specific Windows event log using PowerShell?
questions.explanation: The Get-WinEvent command with the -LogName parameter allows you to retrieve entries from a specific Windows event log.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command can be used to query the Windows Registry for specific keys or values?
questions.explanation: The Get-ItemProperty and Get-Item commands can be used to query the Windows Registry for specific keys or values.

questions.text: How can you use PowerShell to determine the version of the Windows operating system?
questions.explanation: The Get-ComputerInfo command can be used to retrieve detailed information about the computer, including the Windows operating system version.

questions.text: Which PowerShell command can be used to list all running processes and their associated services?
questions.explanation: While Get-Process lists running processes, combining it with Get-Service and other cmdlets allows you to associate processes with their services.
